title: AI Radiology Assistant — Modern Responsive 6-Page Medical UI (Frontend)

requirements.summary: Define and apply a cohesive Tailwind-based clinical theme (teal/green accents, no blue/purple) with consistent typography, spacing, and component styling across the app.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a consistent header/footer (or persistent top navigation) and consistent typography/spacing rules.
Primary/secondary button styles, cards, form fields, badges, and alert styles are consistent across pages.
Meets basic accessibility: legible font sizes, visible focus states, and sufficient contrast for key UI elements.

file_operations.description: Create global Tailwind layers and CSS variables/tokens for a clean clinical palette (off-white backgrounds, slate/charcoal text, teal/green accents), consistent radii/shadows, and accessible focus states; ensure no blue/purple accents are introduced.
Adjust Tailwind theme extension (if needed) to align with the clinical design tokens (typography scale, shadows, radii) and ensure consistent usage across components.

Document the design system decisions (palette, typography, spacing, button/card/form/badge/alert patterns) to keep styling consistent; when using shadcn-ui components, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a shared layout wrapper that applies consistent page container spacing, background, typography defaults, and renders a persistent header/nav + footer; use shadcn-ui primitives where applicable for consistent styling (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

requirements.summary: Implement responsive navigation and routing for Home, Image Upload, Result, AI Explanation, Chatbot, and Report History with active-route indication and mobile collapsible menu.
acceptanceCriteria: User can navigate to each of the 6 pages via the UI on both mobile and desktop layouts.
The current page is visually indicated in the navigation.
Routes render without runtime errors and have sensible empty states where applicable.

file_operations.description: Add client-side routing for the 6 required pages and wrap routes with the shared AppShell layout; ensure routes render with safe empty states (mocked) and no runtime errors.

Implement a responsive top navigation (desktop visible links; mobile collapsible menu) with active route styling and logo placement; use shadcn-ui navigation/menu/button primitives where appropriate (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Create the Home page component and wire it to the Home route.
Create the Image Upload page component and wire it to the Image Upload route.
Create the Result page component and wire it to the Result route.
Create the AI Explanation page component and wire it to the AI Explanation route.
Create the Chatbot page component and wire it to the Chatbot route.
Create the Report History page component and wire it to the Report History route.

requirements.summary: Build a responsive Home page with hero (name + tagline), CTAs to upload and report history, and a “How it works” section describing the flow.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page is responsive and looks intentional on mobile and desktop.
Home page includes clear CTAs that navigate to Image Upload and Report History pages.
User-facing text is in English and uses a professional medical tone.

file_operations.description: Implement the Home layout: hero section (app name + professional tagline), primary CTAs to Image Upload and Report History, and a concise “How it works” section (Upload → Results → Explanation → Chat); use shadcn-ui Button/Card components for consistent CTAs and panels (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

Ensure shared layout provides consistent spacing and typography that supports the Home hero and “How it works” content; use shadcn-ui layout-friendly primitives where applicable (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

requirements.summary: Build an Image Upload page UI with file selection/dropzone, supported format hints, optional metadata fields, preview, and an Analyze action that navigates to Result with a mocked processing state.
acceptanceCriteria: User can select a file and see a preview/filename shown in the UI.
Form fields are responsive and include labels and helper text.
Clicking “Analyze” moves the user to the Result page with a clear loading/processing UI state (mocked).

file_operations.description: Implement upload UI: dropzone/button, supported formats hint, optional metadata fields (Study ID, Modality, Notes), preview area (thumbnail when possible + filename), and Analyze action that transitions to Result with a mocked processing/loading state; use shadcn-ui Input/Textarea/Button/Card components for consistent form styling (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Add lightweight client-side state helpers for storing selected file + metadata and a mocked processing flag to support the Upload→Result UI flow without any AI integration.

Read the mocked processing/result state so that navigation from Analyze shows a clear processing UI then renders mocked result content when ready; use shadcn-ui Skeleton/Badge/Card patterns if available (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

requirements.summary: Build a Result page that displays structured medical output (summary, badges, measurements, annotated image placeholder) and provides actions to Explanation and Chatbot with empty/loading states.
acceptanceCriteria: Result page presents a clear hierarchy: headline summary, details, and supporting visuals.
Includes buttons/links to the AI Explanation page and Chatbot page.
Provides appropriate empty/loading states when no result data is present (mock data allowed).

file_operations.description: Implement the structured Result layout: headline summary findings, confidence/severity badges, key measurements list, and annotated image preview section (placeholder when absent), plus actions linking to AI Explanation and Chatbot; use shadcn-ui Card/Badge/Button components for consistent medical UI hierarchy (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Provide mock report/result data (including measurements, confidence, severity, and optional annotated preview placeholder info) to support Result rendering and empty/loading states.
Wire selecting a report to navigate to the Result view pre-filled with corresponding mock data (client-side only), matching the Result page layout expectations.

requirements.summary: Build an AI Explanation page with sections (What the model saw, Why, Limitations, Next steps) and navigation back to Result and onward to Chatbot using cautious clinical language.
acceptanceCriteria: Explanation content is organized into readable sections with headings and callouts.
Includes navigation back to Result and onward to Chatbot.
All text is in English and uses cautious clinical language (e.g., includes a disclaimer/limitations section).

file_operations.description: Implement readable explanation sections with headings and callouts (What the model saw, Why this conclusion, Limitations/disclaimer, Recommended next steps) using static/mock content; add clear navigation back to Result and onward to Chatbot; use shadcn-ui Card/Alert components if available (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

Ensure the Result page includes a clear action to navigate to AI Explanation, consistent with the app’s button/link styling; use shadcn-ui Button components where applicable (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

requirements.summary: Build a responsive Chatbot page UI with conversation thread, input + send, optional timestamps, suggested prompt chips, and mocked assistant responses after a short delay.
acceptanceCriteria: User can type a message and see it appear in the thread; a mocked assistant response appears after a short delay.
Chat UI is responsive and maintains usability on small screens.
Includes suggested prompt chips and a clear empty state for a new conversation.

file_operations.description: Implement chat UI: scrollable thread, message bubbles, input box + send button, optional timestamps, suggested prompt chips, and empty state for new conversation; use shadcn-ui Input/Button/Badge (chips) and Card components as appropriate (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Add a small hook to manage local conversation state and simulate assistant responses with a short delay (no real-time requirements).
Ensure the Result page includes a clear action to start Chatbot conversation about the current result (navigates to Chatbot and can optionally seed a suggested prompt in client state).

requirements.summary: Build a Report History page listing mock reports with client-side filters/search and navigation to Result pre-filled with the selected report’s mocked details.
acceptanceCriteria: History page shows a list of mock reports with a clear visual hierarchy and responsive layout.
Includes at least one filter or search UI control (client-side, mock).
Clicking a report navigates to the Result page with corresponding mocked details shown.

file_operations.description: Implement responsive list/table of mock reports with strong hierarchy (status, date, modality, summary snippet) plus at least one client-side filter/search control; selecting a report navigates to Result with matching mocked details; use shadcn-ui Input/Select/Button/Card components where applicable (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Expand mock reports dataset to support filtering/search (date/modality/status) and provide details needed to populate the Result page consistently.
Ensure routing supports navigating from Report History to Result while preserving/reporting selected mock report context (client-side only) and shows sensible empty states when no report is selected.

requirements.summary: Add required generated static images (logo + hero illustration) under the public generated assets directory and render them in the UI (logo in header/nav, hero on Home) without backend involvement.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
Home page uses the hero illustration; app header/nav uses the logo icon.
Images render correctly in production build (no backend image proxying).

file_operations.description: Add the generated logo asset at the exact required path so the header/nav can reference it as a static public file.
Add the generated hero illustration asset at the exact required path so the Home page can reference it as a static public file.
Render the logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/ai-radiology-logo.dim_512x512.png within the persistent navigation, ensuring appropriate sizing and accessible alt text.
Render the hero illustration from frontend/public/assets/generated/radiology-hero.dim_1600x900.png in the Home hero section (responsive), alongside the headline/tagline and CTAs.
